title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1.3: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2025, in priority areas, key players in the justice system are able to deliver evidence-based prevention programs for childrenand youth who are offenders, and to provide legal support and rehabilitation services to children and youth in conflict with the law (San-PÃ©dro, SoubrÃ©, Abobo, OdiennÃ©, and Korhogo)., which contributes to Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, girls, boys, and adolescents in CÃ´te d'Ivoire benefit from a legal identity and are protected from violence, exploitation, negligence, and harmful practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, in priority areas, key players in the justice system are able to deliver evidence-based prevention programs forchildrenand youth who are offenders, and to provide legal support and rehabilitation services to children and youth in conflictwith the law (San-Pedro, Soubre, Abobo, Odienne, and Korhogo).

description.narrative: In 2021 the CO worked toward ensuring standardized application of procedures in juvenile justice, in line with national legislation. Support was provided on early prevention mechanisms, access to justice for children and alternatives for detention and for building capacity among judicial actors, as a direct contribution to Key Result for Children 5. With support from the CO, assistance was provided to 541 children in contact with the justice system, legal assistance was provided to 33 children in long-term detention and 93 judges were trained in the new child justice measures. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
